oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 5,10,15,20-Tetra-2-furylporphyrin
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GHOSH, A
BUTCHER, RJ
MOBIN, SM
RAVIKANTH, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: meso-furyl porphyrins
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Molecules of the title macrocycle, C(36)H(22)N(4)O(4), are located on an inversion center. The porphyrin ring shows a wave-like conformation with adjacent pyrrole rings tilted above the porphyrin plane and the interporphyrin distance is 3.584 (3) angstrom. The dihedral angles between the meso-furyl groups and the porphyrin plane are 38.87 (7) and 48.29 (7)degrees; these are much smaller than those observed for meso-tetraphenylporphyrin, indicating that the meso-furyl groups are more inclined towards the porphyrin plane. The decrease in the dihedral angle is due to the presence of intramolecular hydroden bonding between the meso-fury O atom and the beta-pyrrole CH group. Intramolecular N-H center dot center dot center dot N hydrogen bonds are also present.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: ACTA CRYSTALLOGRAPHICA SECTION E-STRUCTURE REPORTS ONLINE, 66(), O1160-U829
